丁丁.definition: sound of chopping wood, chess pieces hitting the board etc

丁丑.definition: fourteenth year D2 of the 60 year cycle, e.g. 1997 or 2057

丁亥.definition: twenty-fourth year D12 of the 60 year cycle, e.g. 2007 or 2067

丁冬.definition: (onom.) ding dong; jingling of bells; clanking sound

丁加奴.definition: Terengganu, northeast state of mainland Malaysia

丁卯.definition: fourth year D4 of the 60 year cycle, e.g. 1987 or 2047

丁夫.definition: (in ancient times) a man old enough for corvée or military service

丁字步.definition: T-step (basic dance position, with the feet forming a T shape)

丁寧.definition: variant of 叮嚀|叮咛[ding1 ning2]

丁寵家庭.definition: double income family who have pets rather than children (see also 丁克[ding1 ke4])

丁巳.definition: fifty-fourth year D6 of the 60 year cycle, e.g. 1977 or 2037

丁巳復辟.definition: Manchu Restoration of 1917, see 張勳復辟|张勋复辟[Zhang1 Xun1 Fu4 bi4]

丁憂.definition: (literary) to be in mourning after the death of a parent

丁是丁，卯是卯.pinyin: dīng shì dīng ， mǎo shì mǎo
丁是丁，卯是卯.definition: lit. to keep ding (the fourth heavenly stem) distinct from mao (the fourth earthly branch) (idiom); fig. meticulous; conscientious; unambiguous

丁未.definition: forty-fourth year D8 of the 60 year cycle, e.g. 1967 or 2027

丁汝昌.definition: Ding Ruchang (1836-1895), commander of the Qing North China Navy

丁玲.definition: Ding Ling (1904-1986), female novelist, author of novel The Sun Shines over the Sanggan River 太陽照在桑乾河上|太阳照在桑干河上, attacked during the 1950s as anti-Party

丁磊.definition: Ding Lei (1971-), founder and CEO of NetEase 網易|网易[Wang3 yi4]

丁糖.definition: tetrose (CH2O)4, monosaccharide with four carbon atoms

丁肇中.definition: Samuel C. C. Ting (1936-), American physicist, 1976 Nobel Prize laureate in physics

丁艱.definition: (literary) to be in mourning after the death of a parent

丁酉.definition: thirty-fourth year D10 of the 60 year cycle, e.g. 1957 or 2017

丁韙良.definition: William A.P. Martin (1827-1916), American missionary who lived 62 years in China between 1850 and 1916, and helped found many Chinese colleges, first president of Peking University
